page.title: 01Arlington and Berwick
page.content: A fairly flat rural area just north of the South Downs. The largest single feature is Arlington Reservoir. The greatest height reached is 42 metres. The A27 trunk road, the B2l08 and BR south coast route all cross the block. 2 centres of population are Arlington village and part of Berwick near the railway station. Main activities are farming & outdoor leisure pursuits. There are 2 areas of woodland, many footpaths and the remains of 2 former brickworks. Amenities include a post office, general food store, garage & petrol station, football pitch, taxi service, the Cuckmere Community bus, fortnightly travelling library,3 pubs, wine cellar, mobile snack bar, village hall, parish church & cemetery, public toilets and parking at picnic areas at Abbots Wood and Arlington Reservoir.
